entries.title: Freedom Convoy 2.0 Cancelled Until Further Notice Due to Security Concerns, Says Organizer
entries.description: Trucks participating in the "Freedom Convoy" depart an area south of Montreal on Jan. 28, 2021. (Noé Chartier/The Epoch Times)

entries.title: Rescuers in Vietnam Try to Save Boy Trapped in Concrete Pile
entries.description: Rescuers gather at the site of where a 10-year-old boy is thought to be trapped in a 35-meter deep shaft at a bridge construction area in Vietnam's Dong Thap province on Jan. 2, 2023. (STR/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: South Africa Gas Truck Explosion Death Toll Rises to 34
entries.description: A burned out vehicle marks the spot where a gas tanker exploded under a bridge in Boksburg, east of Johannesburg, South Africa, on Dec. 24, 2022. (Hein Kaiser/AP Photo)

entries.title: More Than 60 Percent of South Korean Staff Infected With COVID-19 in Embassy and Consulates Across China

entries.title: Camouflaged Cameraman a Hit at World Juniors: ‘I Have the Best Seat in the House’
entries.description: Camera operator Nathan Eides, left, records Canada celebrating a win over Sweden during IIHF World Junior Hockey Championship action in Halifax on Dec. 31, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Darren Calabrese)

entries.title: South Korea’s Military Hails Successful Launch of Solid-Fuel Rocket
entries.description: The first home-launched satellite of South Korea, carried by rocket 'Naro (KSLV-I),' is launched from Naro space center in Goheung, South Korea, on Aug. 25, 2009. (Korea Aerospace Researcher Institute via Getty Images)

entries.title: South Korea Seeks Joint Exercises With US Using Nuclear Assets: PM Yoon
entries.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol speaks during a ceremony marking Korean Memorial Day at the Seoul National cemetery on June 6, 2022. (Chung Sung-Jun/Getty Images)

entries.title: Floods in Philippines Leave 51 Dead, Over a Dozen Missing
entries.description: An elderly woman sits on a chair while being carried by coast guard personnel wading through floodwaters in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental province in the southern Philippines on Dec. 26, 2022. (Philippine Coast Guard via AP)

entries.title: One-Third of Countries Will Fall Into Recession in 2023, Rest Will ‘Feel Like Recession’: IMF

entries.title: Morocco Bans All Arrivals From China Until Further Notice Amid Soaring COVID Cases
entries.description: Travellers walk with their luggage at the arrival hall of the Hong Kong International Airport on Dec. 30, 2022. Authorities around the world are imposing or considering curbs on travelers from China as COVID-19 cases there surge following its relaxation of Zero-COVID rules. (Anthony Kwan/Getty Images)

entries.description: Surfers Paradise on the Gold Coast, Australia. (zstock/Shutterstock)

entries.title: New Research May Produce Non-Hormonal Male Contraceptive

entries.title: 14 Dead, Including 10 Prison Guards, After Armed Attack on Mexican Prison Near US Border
entries.description: Members of the Mexican Army secure an area outside the prison of Ciudad Juarez number 3 after an attack on the prison left 14 people dead and allowed 24 inmates to escape on Jan. 1, 2023. (Herika Martinez/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Greens Accuse Government of Subverting Democratic Processes Over Move to Address Housing Crisis
entries.description: A 'sold' real estate sign is seen outside a high-rise apartment block in Sydney, Australia, on May 8, 2021. (Lisa Maree Williams/Getty Images)

entries.description: Singing notably improved strokes patients' mood, social functioning, and quality of life, study finds. (Shutterstock)

entries.title: Australian Off-Duty Police Officer Drowns in Rip After Saving Teen

entries.title: Australian Road Toll Rises on Pandemic Reopening
entries.description: A file image of a road accident in the city of Melbourne. On average, three people die on Australian roads every day. (David Caird-Pool/Getty Images)

entries.title: Lula Sworn in as Brazil’s President
entries.description: Brazil's new President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva delivers an inaugural speech at Planalto Palace after his inauguration ceremony at the National Congress, in Brasilia, Brazil, on Jan. 1, 2023. (Evaristo Sa/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Canadians Vary Widely on Their Tipping Practices at Restaurants: New Survey
entries.description: Today’s standard tip at a sit-down restaurant is 15 to 20 percent of the cheque before tax is added. (Drazen Zigic/Shutterstock)

entries.title: Justice Centre’s John Carpay Arrested, Released on Bail
